Let’s define these two big words in·ev·i·ta·ble 1.certain to happen; unavoidable."war was inevitable"synonyms:unavoidable, inescapable, inexorable, ineluctable;co·in·ci·dence 1.a remarkable concurrence of events or circumstances without apparent causal connection."it's no coincidence that this new burst of innovation has occurred in the free nations"synonyms:accident, chance, serendipity, fortuity, providence, happenstance, fate; a fluke"too close to be mere coincidence"So the claim is that there are no events that seem connected without actual connection and that the only things that can happen are the things that are certain to happen. Kinda seems like an obvious statement with no real depth to it. It’s just like saying, everything happens for a reason and when something has happened, we’ll say it was always going to happen. Apart from all that, we humans are really good at finding patterns, it’s sort of the reason we were able to survive in the harsh world we find ourselves in. If you look for a connection between two things; ‘There are no coincidences only the inevitable’ fact that you will likely find it.
There are many books, like The Tenth Insight, and others that propose that there is no such thing as a coincidence.
